trans-unit.source: Represents a control designed for entering and handling passwords.
> [!IMPORTANT] > PasswordBox has built-in handling for the bubbling <xref:System.Windows.UIElement.MouseUp> and <xref:System.Windows.UIElement.MouseDown> events.
Consequently, custom event handlers that listen for `MouseUp` or `MouseDown` events from a `PasswordBox` will never be called.

If you need to respond to these events, listen for the tunneling <xref:System.Windows.UIElement.PreviewMouseUp> and <xref:System.Windows.UIElement.PreviewMouseDown> events instead, or register the handlers with the <xref:System.Windows.EventSetter.HandledEventsToo%2A> argument (this latter option is only available through code).

Do not mark the event handled unless you deliberately want to disable PasswordBox native handling of these events, and be aware that this has notable effects on the control's [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_ui](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)].
Customizing the PasswordBox Control To apply the same property settings to multiple PasswordBox controls, use the <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkElement.Style%2A> property.
You can modify the default <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ControlTemplate> to give the control a unique appearance.

For more information about creating a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ControlTemplate>, see [Customizing the Appearance of an Existing Control by Creating a ControlTemplate](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
To see the parts and states that are specific to the PasswordBox, see [PasswordBox Syles and Templates](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
Dependency properties for this control might be set by the control’s default style.
If a property is set by a default style, the property might change from its default value when the control appears in the application.
The default style is determined by which desktop theme is used when the application is running.
For more information, see [Default WPF Themes](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=158252).
> [!NOTE] > Setting a visual property will only have an effect if that property is both present in Button control's default template and is set by using a .

You can find a list of visual properties in the "Changing the Visual Structure of a Control" section in [Customizing the Appearance of an Existing Control by Creating a ControlTemplate](../Topic/Customizing%20the%20Appearance%20of%20an%20Existing%20Control%20by%20Creating%20a%20ControlTemplate.md).
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.PasswordBox"></xref> class.
Gets or sets the brush that specifies the color of the password box's caret.
You can set the CaretBrush property of a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.PasswordBox> to specify the color of its caret.
For example, you can set CaretBrush to be the same value as the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Control.Foreground%2A> property.

<xref:System.Windows.Controls.Control.Foreground%2A> indicates the color of the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.PasswordBox.PasswordChar%2A> characters in the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.PasswordBox>.
A brush that describes the color of the password box's caret.
Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.PasswordBox.CaretBrush*> dependency property.
To be added.
Clears the value of the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.PasswordBox.Password*> property.
The value of the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.PasswordBox.Password%2A> property is <xref:System.String.Empty> after a call to this method.

Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.PasswordBox"></xref> displays selected text when the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.PasswordBox"></xref> does not have focus.
## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to `true`|None|

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.PasswordBox"></xref> displays selected text when the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.PasswordBox"></xref> does not have focus; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
The registered default is <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
For more information about what can influence the value, see [Dependency Property Value Precedence](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.PasswordBox.IsInactiveSelectionHighlightEnabled*> dependency property.
To be added.
Gets a value that indicates whether the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.PasswordBox"></xref> has focus and selected text.
## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to `true`|None|

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.PasswordBox"></xref> has focus and selected text; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
The registered default is <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
For more information about what can influence the value, see [Dependency Property Value Precedence](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.PasswordBox.IsSelectionActive*> dependency property.
To be added.
Gets or sets the maximum length for passwords to be handled by this <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.PasswordBox"></xref>.
This property only restricts passwords entered manually by the user; it has no effect on programmatic manipulation of the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.PasswordBox.Password%2A> property.
## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to `true`|None|
An integer specifying the maximum length, in characters, for passwords to be handled by this <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.PasswordBox"></xref>.
A value of zero (**0**) means no limit.
The default value is **0** (no length limit).
Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.PasswordBox.MaxLength*> dependency property.
To be added.
Called when an internal process or application calls <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkElement.ApplyTemplate*>, which is used to build the current template's visual tree.
Overrides <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkElement.OnApplyTemplate%2A>.
To be added.
To be added.
To be added.
To be added.
To be added.
To be added.
To be added.
To be added.

To be added.

To be added.
To be added.
To be added.
To be added.
To be added.
To be added.
Gets or sets the password currently held by the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.PasswordBox"></xref>.
When you get the Password property value, you expose the password as plain text in memory.
To avoid this potential security risk, use the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.PasswordBox.SecurePassword%2A> property to get the password as a <xref:System.Security.SecureString>.
Setting this property to `null` causes the underlying password to be set to <xref:System.String.Empty>.
A string representing the password currently held by the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.PasswordBox"></xref>.
The default value is <xref:System.String.Empty>.
Occurs when the value of the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.PasswordBox.Password*> property changes.
## Routed Event Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Routing strategy|Bubbling| |Delegate||
To be added.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.PasswordBox.PasswordChanged"></xref> routed event.
To be added.
Gets or sets the masking character for the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.PasswordBox"></xref>.
When text is entered into a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.PasswordBox>, the masking character specified by this property is echoed in the password input field, rather than the actual password itself.
This helps prevent passwords from being exposed to casual observers when they are entered.
## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to `true`|None|
A masking character to echo when the user enters text into the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.PasswordBox"></xref>.
The default value is a bullet character (**●**).
Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.PasswordBox.PasswordChar*> dependency property.
To be added.
Replaces the current selection in the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.PasswordBox"></xref> with the contents of the Clipboard.

This method does not clear the contents of the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.PasswordBox> before the paste; it will either replace the current selection with pasted content, or insert the pasted content at the current cursor position.
Gets the password currently held by the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.PasswordBox"></xref> as a <xref href="System.Security.SecureString"></xref>.
When you get the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.PasswordBox.Password%2A> property value, you expose the password as plain text in memory.
To avoid this potential security risk, use the SecurePassword property to get the password as a <xref:System.Security.SecureString>.
A secure string representing the password currently held by the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.PasswordBox"></xref>.
Selects the entire contents of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.PasswordBox"></xref>.
Gets or sets the brush that highlights selected text.
You can specify the brush that highlights selected text by setting the SelectionBrush and <xref:System.Windows.Controls.PasswordBox.SelectionOpacity%2A> properties.
A brush that highlights selected text.
Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.PasswordBox.SelectionBrush*> dependency property.
To be added.
Gets or sets the opacity of the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.PasswordBox.SelectionBrush*>.
If you set the SelectionOpacity to 0, the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.PasswordBox.SelectionBrush%2A> is transparent and is not visible.
If you set the SelectionOpacity to 1.0 or greater, the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.PasswordBox.SelectionBrush%2A> is opaque and the selected text is not visible.
The opacity of the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.PasswordBox.SelectionBrush*>.
The default is 0.4.
Identifies the SelectionOpacityProperty dependency property.
To be added.
